title: grotesque sans serifs
content:
hello

im looking for a "helveticaesque" grotesque (no, not helvetica!). no frutiger, no myriad, rather along the lines of akkurat or akzidenz grotesk. any further ideas?

it doesnt have to look very modern. monotype grotesque would be an option too, for example. it will be used in an art project about definitions, but its for a school application so i dont want to use helvetica (they could think that i havent thought about font-choice). oh, and it doesnt need to be perfect for setting long texts.. will mostly be used between 10-20pt on small pages anyway.

thanks!
author: thierry blancpain

jupiterboy: you linked the index-page of storms shop.. which one did you want to link?

If you're after something 'helveticesque', go for a neo-grotesque (usually monocular g)\* as opposed to a 'benton-franklinesque(?!?)' old grotesque (usually binocular 'g')\*. Someone please correct me if I'm wrong.

oh, it doesnt have to be too near to helvetica, i just dont want something too "humanistic" (right term?) like frutiger, rather something impersonal (but not constructed/geometric!), like helvetica.

franklin gothic is on my list, too.

Then I think old grotesques are right up your alley, [FF Bau](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219110808/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11312.0.0) and [Benton Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219110808/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/BentonSans) are nice.
